intro: Stangeria katzeri, commonly known as the Cape York grass tree, is a unique flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and striking inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Stangeria katzeri is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a habitat and food source for native wildlife.
